intro: Monanthotaxis ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered monanthotaxis, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
